title: Boeing Pilot Raised Concerns About 737 MAX Years Before Deadly Crashes
text:
A senior Boeing Co. pilot raised concerns about a 737 MAX flight-control system three years ago, but the company didn’t alert federal regulators until 2019, months after two deadly crashes involving the same system, according to the Federal Aviation Administration.

In a 2016 instant-message exchange, Mark Forkner, then Boeing’s chief technical pilot for the MAX, and a colleague named Patrik Gustavsson appeared to discuss the plane maker’s modifications of the system, known as MCAS. The pilots compared notes on problems they...
description: A senior pilot said he had encountered problems with a flight-control system three years ago, but the company didn’t alert federal regulators until 2019, months after two deadly crashes involving the same system.
